intro: Psychotria fissistipula, commonly known as the fissistipular psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. Psychotria fissistipula is often found in moist, shaded forest understories where it thrives in humid conditions.
